H0.text: The armistice to end World War I was signed in November 1918 in a railway carriage in which French town. Reims

H1.text: The armistice to end World War I was signed in November 1918 in a railway carriage in which French town. Verdun

H2.text: The armistice to end World War I was signed in November 1918 in a railway carriage in which French town. Amiens

H3.text: The armistice to end World War I was signed in November 1918 in a railway carriage in which French town. Compiègne

A4.text: The armistice with Germany, agreed at Le Francport near Compiègne, ends fighting in World War I.

A5.text: The Glade of the Armistice in the Compiègne Forest was the site of the signing of two armistices; those of 11 November 1918 and 22 June 1940.
